intro: Croton martii, commonly known as the African croton, is a shrub native to tropical Africa. It is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves that often display striking color variations. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and as a houseplant.
